entries.title: President Trump welcomed Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to the White House for his first visit in seven years
Once one of Trump’s most strident MAGA allies,  Marjorie Taylor Greene now argues he’s out of touch with his base on the economy, foreign policy and the Epstein case
Former Harvard University President Larry Summers said he would be stepping back from public commitments after receiving criticism over his correspondence with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein
President Trump’s grip on the GOP is showing signs of slipping, with Republican support for releasing the Epstein files the latest pushback from his own party
Trump said he would sign legislation to release files related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, one day after he abandoned his longstanding opposition to the measure
Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook’s lawyer on Monday provided the first detailed defense of her mortgage applications
David Richardson, the acting head of FEMA, resigned after about seven months in the role
Trump threw in the towel on dissuading House Republicans from backing a measure to release files related to Jeffrey Epstein, saying that GOP lawmakers should instead embrace the vote
Over 60% of Americans are comfortable with how things are going in their financial lives, but our recent WSJ-NORC poll also revealed significant pessimism about the future of the U.S. economy
President Trump said he is withdrawing his support for GOP Rep. Marjorie Taylor, a longtime backer who called for the release of Justice Department investigative files into Jeffrey Epstein
Bill Pulte has used a low-profile federal housing post to make waves, attacking the president’s foes, ousting ethics watchdogs and championing radical policies
U.S. elections are sending a consistent message: Americans are deeply frustrated with their government’s inability to solve problems
Middle-class voters, many of them frustrated with MAGA and President Trump, could be up for grabs in next year’s midterms
Senate Republicans have tried to persuade their vulnerable Georgia colleague Jon Ossoff to join them in voting to reopen the government, to no avail
Republican Rep. Elise Stefanik, an ally of President Trump, announced a run for New York governor in next year’s election, challenging Democratic incumbent Gov. Kathy Hochul
In Charts: In Virginia and New Jersey gubernatorial elections, the working-class, Hispanic and Black neighborhoods that helped return Trump to the White House moved back to Democrats

A classified Justice Department brief authorizing strikes on drug-smuggling boats in the Caribbean and Pacific describes fentanyl as a potential chemical weapons threat, according to people familiar with the memo
A head-to-head comparison of unmanned aircraft shows the global rivals in a close race
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said that the Pentagon will shake up the way it buys weaponry, equipment and software by making purchases more quickly—and from a broader range of potential suppliers.

The Trump administration is still deciding whether to push Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro out of power or extract concessions from him, according to U.S. officials familiar with the deliberations
The Trump administration believes it can continue its lethal military campaign against alleged drug-running boats without congressional authorization
